Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that is receiving water and light, showing it growing well.
The student can draw a plant that is not receiving water, showing it not growing well or wilting.
The student can draw a plant that is not receiving light, showing it not growing well or wilting.
The student can use their drawing to show that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
The student can identify and label patterns in their drawing, such as how plants look when they lack water or light.
